hitStopTime.tooltip: Unclear. This isn't hitbox duration, which is determined by the duration of the triggering TAE event. It may be the duration of the 'hit' flag on the target. Always set to 0, 0.08. or 0.11.

spEffectId0.tooltip: Special effect applied to target on hit (slot 0).

spEffectId1.tooltip: Special effect applied to target on hit (slot 1).

spEffectId2.tooltip: Special effect applied to target on hit (slot 2).

spEffectId3.tooltip: Special effect applied to target on hit (slot 3).

spEffectId4.tooltip: Special effect applied to target on hit (slot 4).

hit0_DmyPoly1.tooltip: Model point at origin of hitbox (slot 0). If Hitbox0EndModelPoint is not -1, the hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

hit1_DmyPoly1.tooltip: Model point at origin of hitbox (slot 1). If Hitbox1EndModelPoint is not -1, the hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

hit2_DmyPoly1.tooltip: Model point at origin of hitbox (slot 2). If Hitbox2EndModelPoint is not -1, the hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

hit3_DmyPoly1.tooltip: Model point at origin of hitbox (slot 3). If Hitbox3EndModelPoint is not -1, the hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

hit0_DmyPoly2.tooltip: Model point at end of capsule hitbox (slot 0). If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox0StartModelPoint.

hit1_DmyPoly2.tooltip: Model point at end of capsule hitbox (slot 1). If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox1StartModelPoint.

hit2_DmyPoly2.tooltip: Model point at end of capsule hitbox (slot 2). If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox2StartModelPoint.

hit3_DmyPoly2.tooltip: Model point at end of capsule hitbox (slot 3). If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox3StartModelPoint.

atkPhysCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate physical attack damage.

atkMagCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate magic attack damage.

atkFireCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate fire attack damage.

atkThunCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate lightning attack damage.

atkStamCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate stamina damage.

guardAtkRateCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character guard attack power. Throw attacks have a value of 9900, which must essentially ignore blocking completely.

guardBreakCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character guard breaking power. Not sure what that is, exactly, but this is set to 0 for parries and 100 for all other attacks.

atkThrowEscapeCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to weapon attacks during throws. Generally set to 100, except for throw attacks themselves.

atkSuperArmorCorrection.tooltip: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to damage to target poise. Generally set to 100, except for throw attacks themselves.

atkPhys.tooltip: Absolute physical attack power of attack.

atkMag.tooltip: Absolute magic attack power of attack.

atkFire.tooltip: Absolute fire attack power of attack.

atkThun.tooltip: Absolute lightning attack power of attack.

atkStam.tooltip: Absolute stamina attack power of attack.

guardAtkRate.tooltip: Absolute guard attack power of attack.

guardBreakRate.tooltip: Absolute guard breaking power of attack.

atkSuperArmor.tooltip: Absolute poise attack power of attack.

atkThrowEscape.tooltip: Absolute attack power of attack. Never used.

atkObj.tooltip: Amount of damage dealt to objects by this attack.

guardStaminaCutRate.tooltip: Correction applied to the stamina required to block this attack (I presume). Never used.

guardRate.tooltip: Percentage correction made to the guarding ability of the attack, as set in weapon parameters or NPC parameters. Only used to halve the guarding ability of parries (-50).

throwTypeId.tooltip: Throw to trigger when attack hits. For some reason, throws are triggered using this ID, which is a field within each Throw table entry rather than the ID of the Throw table entry itself.

hit0_hitType.tooltip: Type of hit applied by hitbox (slot 0). Always zero, except for some whip attacks.

hit1_hitType.tooltip: Type of hit applied by hitbox (slot 1). Always zero, except for some whip attacks.

hit2_hitType.tooltip: Type of hit applied by hitbox (slot 2). Always zero, except for some whip attacks.

hit3_hitType.tooltip: Type of hit applied by hitbox (slot 3). Always zero, except for some whip attacks.

hti0_Priority.tooltip: Priority of hitbox (slot 0). If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs. Never used.

hti1_Priority.tooltip: Priority of hitbox (slot 1). If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs. Never used.

hti2_Priority.tooltip: Priority of hitbox (slot 2). If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs. Never used.

hti3_Priority.tooltip: Priority of hitbox (slot 3). If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs. Never used.

dmgLevel.tooltip: Impact level of attack, which determines how the target reacts to it (e.g. knocked backward, launched into the air, etc.). Certain special effects on the target (e.g. Iron Flesh) may re-map this impact level to a different one.

mapHitType.tooltip: Determines how this attack interacts with the map.

guardCutCancelRate.tooltip: Percentage (from -100 to 100) of target's current guard rate to ignore. A value of 100 will ignore guarding completely, and a value of -100 will double their guarding effectiveness. Never used, in favor of the simple 'IgnoreGuard' boolean field.

atkAttribute.tooltip: Type of physical damage done by attack.

spAttribute.tooltip: Type of elemental damage done by attack. (Attacks can apply any combination of damage types, but this value will determine what visual effects the attack generates, etc.)

atkType.tooltip: Determines the sounds and visual effects generated by the attack itself (before hit).

atkMaterial.tooltip: Determines the sounds and visual effects generated when the attack hits. A value of 255 uses the weapon default.

atkSize.tooltip: Internal description says this determines the size of sounds and visual effects, but it is never used.

defMaterial.tooltip: Determines the sound effects used when guarding. Usually 255 for Player Attacks and 0 (if not a block) or 50 (if blocking) for Non-Player Attacks.

defSfxMaterial.tooltip: Determines the visual effects used when guarding. Usually 255 for Player Attacks and 0 (if not a block) or 50 (if blocking) for Non-Player Attacks.

hitSourceType.tooltip: Internal description says 'specify where you get the model point for attack'. Set to 1 for parries, ripostes, and basic body attacks (falling, rolling, etc.), and zero otherwise. Use that pattern.

throwFlag.tooltip: Determines how this attack relates to throws: not at all, a throw trigger, or a throw damage parameter.

disableGuard:1.tooltip: If True, this attack cannot be blocked (e.g. throws).

disableStaminaAttack:1.tooltip: If True, this attack will deal no stamina damage, regardless of its stamina attack power.

disableHitSpEffect:1.tooltip: If True, this attack will trigger no special effects on the target. Internal description mentions this is an 'SCE bug countermeasure' (referring to the original Dark Souls demo).

IgnoreNotifyMissSwingForAI:1.tooltip: If True, the character's AI will not be informed when this attack misses. Enabled for basic body attacks (falling, rolling, ladder punches, etc.) that are generally not considered to be serious attacks.

repeatHitSfx:1.tooltip: If True, sound effects will supposedly be repeated as long as the attack continuously hits a wall. Never enabled, which is probably a good thing.

isArrowAtk:1.tooltip: Flags if this is the attack damage parameter of a physical projectile (arrow, bolt, or throwing knife).

isGhostAtk:1.tooltip: Flags if this is an attack of a ghost, which presumably disables wall collision, etc.

isDisableNoDamage:1.tooltip: If True, this attack will ignore invincibility frames from rolling or backstepping (but not other sources of invincibility such as TAE or events).

behaviorJudgeId.tooltip: This is the ID specified by TAE events that trigger behaviors.

refType.tooltip: Is the reference ID below an Attack or Bullet ID?

category.tooltip: Determines compatibility with special effects that affect certain types of attacks. Set to 'Basic' for thrown goods and 'No Category' otherwise.

heroPoint.tooltip: Humanity cost of behavior. Never used.

atkId_Bullet.tooltip: Attack parameters for bullet impact. Only certain fields in the attack parameter are used. Could be directed to either PlayerAttacks table or NonPlayerAttacks table, depending on the bullet's owner. Set to 0 if bullet has no attack data (no damage).

sfxId_Bullet.tooltip: Visual effect ID for bullet projectile.

sfxId_Hit.tooltip: Visual effect ID for bullet impact.

sfxId_Flick.tooltip: Visual effect ID for when bullet is blocked (I think). Used predominantly for arrows and throwing knives.

life.tooltip: Maximum time before bullet will disappear on its own. -1 means it will last indefinitely.

dist.tooltip: Distance at which attenuation of the projectile begins.

shootInterval.tooltip: Time between emitted bullets. Does nothing for bullets that only shoot once and is generally left at zero for those bullets.

gravityInRange.tooltip: Downward acceleration of bullet. Rarely used.

gravityOutRange.tooltip: Downward acceleration of bullet after it passes the attenuation distance.

hormingStopRange.tooltip: Bullet will stop homing if it is within this distance of its homing target. Use this to prevent homing bullets from being too oppressive.

accelInRange.tooltip: Forward acceleration acting on bullet before it reaches the attenuation distance. Negative values will slow the bullet down.

accelOutRange.tooltip: Forward acceleration acting on bullet after it passes the attenuation distance. Negative values will slow the bullet down.

maxVellocity.tooltip: Maximum speed of bullet, regardless of acceleration.

minVellocity.tooltip: Minimum speed of bullet, regardless of acceleration.

accelTime.tooltip: Time that acceleration is active after bullet creation.

homingBeginDist.tooltip: Distance from owner at which the bullet starts homing in on targets.

hitRadius.tooltip: Initial hit radius of bullet projectile.

hitRadiusMax.tooltip: Final hit radius of bullet projectile. Set to -1 if radius does not change, which is always coupled with a value of 0 for RadiusIncreaseDuration.

spreadTime.tooltip: Time taken by bullet to transition from initial to final hit radius. Value of 0 are always coupled with values of -1 for RadiusIncreaseDuration. I'm not sure if this can actually decrease the hit radius if the final value is less than the initial value.

expDelay.tooltip: Delay between impact and 'explosion' (not sure if that refers to the visual effect and/or hitbox). Never used (always zero).

hormingOffsetRange.tooltip: Internal description: 'When shooting, aim to shift each component of XYZ by this amount.' Nonzero only for Hydra blasts and Vagrant attacks.

dmgHitRecordLifeTime.tooltip: Duration of bullet impact hitbox. A value of zero means it is disabled immediately after first impact.

externalForce.tooltip: Unknown. Used only for Gargoyle fire breath and Undead Dragon poison breath.

spEffectIDForShooter.tooltip: Special effect applied to owner when bullet is created. (Unclear if it is applied repeatedly by repeating bullets.)

autoSearchNPCThinkID.tooltip: AI parameter ID for triggered floating bullets. Only used by Homing [Crystal] Soulmass (10000) and Pursuers (10001) in the vanilla game.

HitBulletID.tooltip: Bullet emitted on impact of this bullet. Used often for 'throw'/'landing' or 'parent'/'child' combinations, like a thrown Firebomb (bullet 110) triggering a fiery explosion (bullet 111). These can be chained together indefinitely (see White Dragon Breath, bullet 11500).

spEffectId0.tooltip: Special effect applied to target hit by bullet. (Slot 0)

spEffectId1.tooltip: Special effect applied to target hit by bullet. (Slot 1)

spEffectId2.tooltip: Special effect applied to target hit by bullet. (Slot 2)

spEffectId3.tooltip: Special effect applied to target hit by bullet. (Slot 3)

spEffectId4.tooltip: Special effect applied to target hit by bullet. (Slot 4)

numShoot.tooltip: Number of bullets emitted at once.

homingAngle.tooltip: Turning angle of homing bullet per second. Higher values are better for homing.

shootAngle.tooltip: Angle of first bullet in degrees around the vertical axis, relative to the forward direction.

shootAngleInterval.tooltip: Angle from one bullet to the next around the vertical axis, beginning at the azimuth angle start.

damageDamp.tooltip: Percentage reduction in physical damage per second.

spelDamageDamp.tooltip: Percentage reduction in magic damage per second.

fireDamageDamp.tooltip: Percentage reduction in fire damage per second.

thunderDamageDamp.tooltip: Percentage reduction in lightning damage per second.

staminaDamp.tooltip: Percentage reduction in stamina damage per second.

knockbackDamp.tooltip: Percentage reduction in knockback power per second.

shootAngleXZ.tooltip: Angle of elevation of first bullet. Positive values will angle the bullets up (e.g. Quelaag's fireballs) and negative values will angle the bullets down (e.g. most breath attacks).

lockShootLimitAng.tooltip: Unknown, but likely important. Set to 30 for most basic projectile magic.

isPenetrate.tooltip: Bullet will go through objects, players, and NPCs.

prevVelocityDirRate.tooltip: Internal description: 'Ratio of adding the previous moving direction to the current direction when a sliding bullet hits the wall.' Like ExternalForce, this is used only for Gargoyle and Undead Dragon breath (100) and is zero for everything else.

atkAttribute.tooltip: Attack type. Almost always 4 ('other'), but sometimes 3 (knives/arrows/bolts).

Material_AttackType.tooltip: Determines visual effects of bullet hit.

Material_AttackMaterial.tooltip: Sound and visual effects on hit.

launchConditionType.tooltip: Condition for determing if a new bullet will be generated when this bullet lands or expires.

EmittePosType:3.tooltip: Origin type of bullet. Usually comes from model points ('damipoly').

isAttackSFX:1.tooltip: Set whether bullets (e.g. arrows) stay stuck upon impact.

isEndlessHit:1.tooltip: Bullet hitbox is continuous (I think). Only used for corrosion cloud in vanilla.

isPenetrateMap:1.tooltip: Bullet will pierce the map (e.g. Stray Demon blast).

isUseSharedHitList:1.tooltip: Repeating bullets share the amount of times they have hit a target (usually so the target is only hit once by any of those repeating bullets).

isUseMultiDmyPolyIfPlace:1.tooltip: Set to True if the same model point ('damipoly') is used multiple times when spawning the bullet.

attachEffectType:2.tooltip: Mostly 0, but sometimes 1 (Dragon Head breath, Grant AoE, Force miracles).

isHitForceMagic:1.tooltip: If True, this bullet will impact appropriate Force-type magic (e.g. arrows, bolts, knives).

isIgnoreSfxIfHitWater:1.tooltip: If True, hit VFX are not produced if the bullet impacts water.

isIgnoreMoveStateIfHitWater:1.tooltip: Unclear effect, but True for knives/arrows/bolts and False otherwise.

isHitDarkForceMagic:1.tooltip: If True, this bullet will impact the Silver Pendant shield effect. True only for dark sorceries.

stageMaxVal0.tooltip: Y-intercept in equation of 'stage max' line 0.

stageMaxVal1.tooltip: Y-intercept in equation of 'stage max' line 1.

stageMaxVal2.tooltip: Y-intercept in equation of 'stage max' line 2.

stageMaxVal3.tooltip: Y-intercept in equation of 'stage max' line 3.

stageMaxVal4.tooltip: Y-intercept in equation of 'stage max' line 4.

stageMaxGrowVal0.tooltip: Slope in equation of 'stage max' line 0.

stageMaxGrowVal1.tooltip: Slope in equation of 'stage max' line 1.

stageMaxGrowVal2.tooltip: Slope in equation of 'stage max' line 2.

stageMaxGrowVal3.tooltip: Slope in equation of 'stage max' line 3.

stageMaxGrowVal4.tooltip: Slope in equation of 'stage max' line 4.

adjPt_maxGrowVal0.tooltip: Adjustment factor for slope in equation of 'stage max' line 0.

adjPt_maxGrowVal1.tooltip: Adjustment factor for slope in equation of 'stage max' line 1.

adjPt_maxGrowVal2.tooltip: Adjustment factor for slope in equation of 'stage max' line 2.

adjPt_maxGrowVal3.tooltip: Adjustment factor for slope in equation of 'stage max' line 3.

adjPt_maxGrowVal4.tooltip: Adjustment factor for slope in equation of 'stage max' line 4.

init_inclination_soul.tooltip: Initial slope of equation determining levelling costs (alpha 1).

adjustment_value.tooltip: 'Early' adjustment value of equation determining levelling costs (alpha 2).

boundry_inclination_soul.tooltip: Slope of equation determining required levelling souls after 'LateLevellingCostThreshold' value (alpha 3).

boundry_value.tooltip: Threshold at which 'LateLevellingCostSlope' takes over for levelling (t).

equip_Wep_Right.tooltip: First (default) weapon/shield equipped in right hand.

equip_Subwep_Right.tooltip: Second weapon/shield equipped in right hand.

equip_Wep_Left.tooltip: First (default) weapon/shield equipped in left hand.

equip_Subwep_Left.tooltip: Second weapon/shield equipped in left hand.

equip_Accessory01.tooltip: First ring equipped. Note that up to five rings can be equipped to human NPCs.

equip_Accessory02.tooltip: Second ring equipped. Note that up to five rings can be equipped to human NPCs.

equip_Accessory03.tooltip: Third ring equipped. Note that up to five rings can be equipped to human NPCs.

equip_Accessory04.tooltip: Fourth ring equipped. Note that up to five rings can be equipped to human NPCs.

equip_Accessory05.tooltip: Fifth ring equipped. Note that up to five rings can be equipped to human NPCs.

baseHp.tooltip: Base amount of maximum HP (excluding effects of vitality).

baseMp.tooltip: Base amount of maximum MP (unused in Dark Souls).

baseSp.tooltip: Base maximum stamina (excluding effects of endurance).

arrowNum.tooltip: Count of arrows equipped in slot 1.

boltNum.tooltip: Count of arrows equipped in slot 2.

subArrowNum.tooltip: Count of bolts equipped in slot 1.

subBoltNum.tooltip: Count of bolts equipped in slot 2.

QWC_sb.tooltip: Unknown. Likely to be unused world tendency effect.

QWC_mw.tooltip: Unknown. Likely to be unused world tendency effect.

QWC_cd.tooltip: Unknown. Likely to be unused world tendency effect.

soulLv.tooltip: Soul level, independent of actual stats. Determines amount of souls rewarded by human NPCs.

baseVit.tooltip: Base vitality level. Determines maximum health.

baseWil.tooltip: Base attunement level. Determines spell slots and casting speed.

baseEnd.tooltip: Base endurance level. Determines maximum stamina and equip load.

baseStr.tooltip: Base strength level. Affects strength-based weapons and damage.

baseDex.tooltip: Base dexterity level. Affects skill-based weapons and damage.

baseMag.tooltip: Base intelligence level. Affects magic usability and effectiveness.

baseFai.tooltip: Base faith level. Affects miracle usability and effectiveness.

baseLuc.tooltip: Base luck level. Improves chances of rare item drops.

baseDurability.tooltip: Base resistance level. Improves resistances to status ailments.

itemNum_01.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 1.

itemNum_02.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 2.

itemNum_03.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 3.

itemNum_04.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 4.

itemNum_05.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 5.

itemNum_06.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 6.

itemNum_07.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 7.

itemNum_08.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 8.

itemNum_09.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 9.

itemNum_10.tooltip: Count of good equipped in slot 10.

farDofBegin.tooltip: Distance (m) at which far depth of field blur begins.

farDofEnd.tooltip: Distance (m) at which far depth of field blur ends (reaches maximum).

farDofMul.tooltip: Amount of far depth of field blur applied between the start and end distances.

nearDofBegin.tooltip: Distance (m) at which near depth of field blur begins (further away than end distance).

nearDofEnd.tooltip: Distance (m) at which near depth of field blur ends (reaches maximum) (closer than start distance).

nearDofMul.tooltip: Amount of near depth of field blur applied between start and end distances.

dispersionSq.tooltip: Squared dispersion of depth of field blur (greater value means more blur).

materialId02.tooltip: Second good required to upgrade weapon. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

materialId03.tooltip: Second good required to upgrade weapon. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

materialId04.tooltip: Second good required to upgrade weapon. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

materialId05.tooltip: Second good required to upgrade weapon. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

itemNum01.tooltip: Amount of Upgrade Good required for reinforcement.

itemNum02.tooltip: Amount of Upgrade Good 2 required for upgrade. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

itemNum03.tooltip: Amount of Upgrade Good 3 required for upgrade. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

itemNum04.tooltip: Amount of Upgrade Good 4 required for upgrade. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

itemNum05.tooltip: Amount of Upgrade Good 5 required for upgrade. Never used, and the upgrade menu can't display it (though it may still work as a requirement).

isDisableDispNum01:1.tooltip: If True, the upgrade quantity will not be shown. Often used when only one of the upgrade good is needed.

isDisableDispNum02:1.tooltip: If True, the upgrade quantity for Upgrade Good 2 will not be shown. Often used when only one of the upgrade good is needed (though again, this slot is never used).

isDisableDispNum03:1.tooltip: If True, the upgrade quantity for Upgrade Good 3 will not be shown. Often used when only one of the upgrade good is needed (though again, this slot is never used).

isDisableDispNum04:1.tooltip: If True, the upgrade quantity for Upgrade Good 4 will not be shown. Often used when only one of the upgrade good is needed (though again, this slot is never used).

isDisableDispNum05:1.tooltip: If True, the upgrade quantity for Upgrade Good 5 will not be shown. Often used when only one of the upgrade good is needed (though again, this slot is never used).

refId.tooltip: Special effect applied when accessory is equipped.

sfxVariationId.tooltip: SFX variation ID combined with the value specified in TAE animation data. Always -1; likely works with unused Behavior parameter below.

weight.tooltip: Weight of accessory. Always set to zero in vanilla Dark Souls, but likely works just like other equipment.

behaviorId.tooltip: Behavior of accessory 'skill'. Always zero in the vanilla game.

sellValue.tooltip: Amount of souls received when fed to Frampt. (Set to -1 to prevent it from being sold.

equipModelId.tooltip: Always zero. (Rings have no model, presumably.)

iconId.tooltip: Icon ID of ring in menu.

shopLv.tooltip: Internal description: 'Level that can be solved in the shop.' Unknown and unused (rings have no level).

trophySGradeId.tooltip: Index of ring as it contributes to certain multi-item achievements (none for rings).

trophySeqId.tooltip: Achievement unlocked when ring is acquired (Covenant of Artorias).

refCategory.tooltip: Always set to Special Effects. No idea what happens if you set it to Attacks for a ring...

spEffectCategory.tooltip: Determines what type of special effects affect the stats of this equipment. Unused for rings.

isDeposit:1.tooltip: If True, this ring can be stored in the Bottomless Box. Always True for rings.

isEquipOutBrake:1.tooltip: If True, this ring will break when it is unequipped (e.g. Ring of Favor and Protection).

disableMultiDropShare:1.tooltip: If True, this ring cannot be given to other players by dropping it. Always False in vanilla.

sfxVariationId.tooltip: Animation variation ID to combine with the base usage animation.

weight.tooltip: Weight of good. Never used in vanilla Dark Souls.

basicPrice.tooltip: Unsure. Does not appear to be used.

sellValue.tooltip: Amount of souls received when fed to Frampt. (Set to -1 to prevent it from being sold.

behaviorId.tooltip: Behavior triggered by good use. Never used.

replaceItemId.tooltip: Good to replace when this item is obtained. Used only for full/empty Estus Flask exchange.

yesNoDialogMessageId.tooltip: Message displayed in yes/no dialog box to confirm use of good.

magicId.tooltip: Spell unlocked in attunement menu by possession of this good. (Usually matches the good ID.)

shopLv.tooltip: Level of good that can be sold in 'the shop'. Always -1 or 0. Probably unused.

compTrophySedId.tooltip: Collection achievement (e.g. all spells) to which obtaining this good contributes.

trophySeqId.tooltip: Achievement unlocked when this good is first obtained (e.g. Estus Flask).

maxNum.tooltip: Maximum number of good that can be held at once.

consumeHeroPoint.tooltip: Humanity cost of using good. Always zero.

overDexterity.tooltip: 'Skill over start value'. Unknown effect; set to 0 for spells and 50 otherwise.

goodsType.tooltip: Determines if this is a basic good, upgrade material, key item, or spell.

refCategory.tooltip: Indicates if this good triggers a Bullet or Special Effect. (Attacks are possible, but unused.)

spEffectCategory.tooltip: Determines compatibility with special effects that affect certain types of attacks. Set to 'Basic' for thrown goods and 'No Category' otherwise.

goodsCategory.tooltip: Never used. Only one value (0) used.

goodsUseAnim.tooltip: Points to basic animation used when good is used. Visual/sound effects are set by the variation ID.

opmeMenuType.tooltip: Menu activated (if any) when good is used. Generally only 'No Menu' or 'Yes or No Menu' will be useful.

useLimitCategory.tooltip: Only one good-triggered special effect with this category can be active at once. Additional attempts to use goods in this category will be prevented. (Unclear how Dragon Stones work, though.)

replaceCategory.tooltip: The special effect triggered by this good will replace any special effects in the same category as this one. Used only by Dragon Stones.

vowType0:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters with no covenant.

vowType1:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Way of White.

vowType2:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Princess's Guard.

vowType3:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Warriors of Sunlight.

vowType4:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Darkwraith covenant.

vowType5:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Path of the Dragon.

vowType6:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Gravelord Servants.

vowType7:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Forest Hunters.

vowType8:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Blades of the Darkmoon.

vowType9:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in the Chaos Servant covenant.

vowType10:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in unused covenant 10.

vowType11:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in unused covenant 11.

vowType12:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in unused covenant 12.

vowType13:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in unused covenant 13.

vowType14:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in unused covenant 14.

vowType15:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters in unused covenant 15.

enable_live:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters who have revived to Human status.

enable_gray:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by characters who are Hollow.

enable_white:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by White Phantoms (summons).

enable_black:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used by Black Phantoms (invaders).

enable_multi:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used while multiple players are together.

enable_pvp:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used while in multiplayer PvP (invasion/arena).

disable_offline:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be used while the game is disconnected from the network.

isEquip:1.tooltip: Determines if this good can be equipped in a quick item slot.

isConsume:1.tooltip: Determines if this good is consumed (count decreases) when used.

isAutoEquip:1.tooltip: Determines if this good will be equipped in an available quick slot when obtained.

isEstablishment:1.tooltip: Unknown; need to look at usage.

isOnlyOne:1.tooltip: Determines if only one of this good exists in the game.

isDrop:1.tooltip: Determines if this item can be dropped.

isDeposit:1.tooltip: Determines if good can be stored in Bottomless Box.

isDisableHand:1.tooltip: Not sure. Could disable model hand when good is used?

IsTravelItem:1.tooltip: Not sure. Could flag items that warp the player.

isSuppleItem:1.tooltip: Not sure. Only enabled for empty Estus Flask.

isFullSuppleItem:1.tooltip: Not sure. Only enabled for non-empty Estus Flask.

isEnhance:1.tooltip: Determines if this is an upgrade material.

isFixItem:1.tooltip: Probably True for Repair Powder, etc.

disableMultiDropShare:1.tooltip: If True, this good cannot be given to other players by dropping it.

disableUseAtColiseum:1.tooltip: If True, this good cannot be used in the PvP Arena in Oolacile.

disableUseAtOutOfColiseum:1.tooltip: If True, this good cannot be used outside the PvP Arena in Oolacile.

fixPrice.tooltip: Amount of souls required to repair armor fully. Actual repair cost is this multiplied by current durability over max durability.

basicPrice.tooltip: Unsure when this is used. Possibly sets the default if the cost is not specified in Shop parameters. Always set to 200.

sellValue.tooltip: Amount of souls received when fed to Frampt. (Set to -1 to prevent it from being sold.

residentSpEffectId.tooltip: Special effect granted to wearer (first of three).

disableMultiDropShare:1.tooltip: If True, this armor cannot be given to other players by dropping it. Always False in vanilla.

oldSortId.tooltip: Sorting index for an obsolete build of the game. No effect.

behaviorVariationId.tooltip: Multiplied by 1000 and added to player behavior lookups (hitboxes, bullets) triggered by TAE.

weaponWeightRate.tooltip: Unknown effect. Value is about evenly split between 0 and 1 across weapons, with no obvious pattern.

fixPrice.tooltip: Amount of souls required to repair weapon fully. Actual repair cost is this multiplied by current durability over max durability.

sellValue.tooltip: Amount of souls received when fed to Frampt. (Set to -1 to prevent it from being sold.

correctStrength.tooltip: Amount of attack power gained from strength. (I believe this is the percentage of the player's strength to add to the weapon's attack power, but it also depends on ScalingFormulaType below.)

correctAgility.tooltip: Amount of attack power gained from dexterity. (I believe this is the percentage of the player's dexterity to add to the weapon's attack power, but it also depends on ScalingFormulaType below.).

correctFaith.tooltip: Amount of attack power gained from faith. (I believe this is the percentage of the player's faith to add to the weapon's attack power, but it also depends on ScalingFormulaType below.)

antiDemonDamageRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to damage dealt against demons with this weapon.

antSaintDamageRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to damage dealt against enemies weak to divine (e.g. skeletons) with this weapon.

antWeakA_DamageRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to damage dealt against Gods and Goddesses with this weapon.

antWeakB_DamageRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to damage dealt against enemies from the Abyss with this weapon.

durability.tooltip: Durability of weapon when it is obtained. Always equal to max durability in vanilla game.

attackThrowEscape.tooltip: Power for escaping throws. Always 1, except for a few (and only a few) of the ghost replacement weapons.

parryDamageLife.tooltip: Maximum parry window duration (cannot exceed TAE duration). Always set to 10.

attackBasePhysics.tooltip: Base physical damage of weapon attacks.

attackBaseMagic.tooltip: Base magic damage of weapon attacks.

attackBaseFire.tooltip: Base fire damage of weapon attacks.

attackBaseThunder.tooltip: Base lightning damage of weapon attacks.

attackBaseStamina.tooltip: Base stamina damage of weapon attacks.

saWeaponDamage.tooltip: Base poise damage of weapon attacks.

saDurability.tooltip: Poise gained during attack animations with this weapon. Never used (probably done in TAE).

guardAngle.tooltip: Angle that can be guarded with this weapon. Never used.

staminaGuardDef.tooltip: Defense against (i.e. value subtracted from) stamina attack damage while guarding.

reinforceTypeId.tooltip: Weapon Upgrade parameter that specifies upgrade benefits.

trophySGradeId.tooltip: Index of weapon as it contributes to the Knight's Honor achievement.

trophySeqId.tooltip: Achievement unlocked when weapon is upgraded to maximum level (one per upgrade path).

throwAtkRate.tooltip: Percentage damage increase (if positive) or decrease (if negative) during backstabs and ripostes with this weapon.

bowDistRate.tooltip: Percentage range increase (if positive) or decrease (if negative) with this bow.

equipModelCategory.tooltip: Model category for equipment. Only one option for weapons.

equipModelGender.tooltip: Model gender variant. All weapons are genderless.

weaponCategory.tooltip: Basic category of weapon. Many 'weapon types' you may be familiar with are merged here (e.g. whips are straight swords).

wepmotionCategory.tooltip: Basic weapon attack animation type. More diverse than WeaponCategory. This number is multiplied by 10000 and used as an animation offset for all attacks, I believe.

atkMaterial.tooltip: Determines the sounds and visual effects generated when this weapon hits.

defMaterial.tooltip: Determines the visual effects generated when this weapon blocks an attack.

defSfxMaterial.tooltip: Determines the sound effects generated when this weapon blocks an attack.

correctType.tooltip: Determines how scaling changes with attribute level.

spAttribute.tooltip: Element attached to hits with this weapon.

spAtkcategory.tooltip: Overrides AttackAnimationCategory for some attacks. Ranges from 50 to 199 (or 0 for none). Often used to give weapons unique strong (R2) attacks, for example, but can override any attack animation.

wepmotionOneHandId.tooltip: Animation category for one-handed non-attack animations (like walking).

wepmotionBothHandId.tooltip: Animation category for two-handed non-attack animations (like walking).

properStrength.tooltip: Required strength to wield weapon properly. (Reduced by one third if held two-handed.)

properAgility.tooltip: Required dexterity to wield weapon properly.

properMagic.tooltip: Required intelligence to wield weapon properly.

properFaith.tooltip: Required faith to wield weapon properly.

overStrength.tooltip: Unknown. Always set to 99, except for arrows and bolts.

guardBaseRepel.tooltip: Determines if an enemy will be deflected when you block them with this weapon (by comparing it to their DeflectOnAttack).

attackBaseRepel.tooltip: Determines if this weapon will be deflected when attacking a blocking enemy (by comparing it to their DeflectOnBlock).

guardCutCancelRate.tooltip: Percentage (from -100 to 100) of target's current guard rate to ignore. A value of 100 will ignore guarding completely, and a value of -100 will double their guarding effectiveness. Never used, in favor of the simple 'IgnoreGuard' boolean field.

guardLevel.tooltip: Internal description: 'in which guard motion is the enemy attacked when guarded?' Exact effects are unclear, but this ranges from 0 to 4 in effectiveness of blocking in a predictable way (daggers are worse than swords, which are worse than greatswords, which are worse than all shields).

poisonGuardResist.tooltip: Percentage of incoming poison damage ignored when guarding.

diseaseGuardResist.tooltip: Percentage of incoming toxic damage ignored when guarding.

bloodGuardResist.tooltip: Percentage of incoming bleed damage ignored when guarding.

curseGuardResist.tooltip: Percentage of incoming curse damage ignored when guarding.

isDurabilityDivergence.tooltip: Determines an alternate animation used if the player tries to use this weapon's special attack without having enough durability to use it. Exact enumeration is unknown, but existing usages are documented.

rightHandEquipable:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can be equipped in the right hand.

leftHandEquipable:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can be equipped in the left hand.

bothHandEquipable:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can be held in two-handed mode.

arrowSlotEquipable:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon will use equipped arrow slot.

boltSlotEquipable:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon will use equipped bolt slot.

enableGuard:1.tooltip: If True, the player can guard with this weapon by holding L1.

enableParry:1.tooltip: If True, the player can parry with this weapon by pressing L2.

enableMagic:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can be used to cast sorceries.

enableSorcery:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can be used to cast pyromancy.

enableMiracle:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can be used to cast miracles.

disableRepair:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon cannot be repaired.

isDarkHand:1.tooltip: Enabled only for the Dark Hand.

isVersusGhostWep:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can hit ghosts without a Transient Curse active.

baseChangeCategory:6.tooltip: Never used. Likely Demon's Souls junk.

isDeposit:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon can be stored in the Bottomless Box. Always True for rings.

disableMultiDropShare:1.tooltip: If True, this weapon cannot be given to other players by dropping it. Always False in vanilla.

oldSortId.tooltip: Sorting index for an obsolete build of the game. No effect.

hairColor_B.tooltip: Blue channel of hair color (0 to 255).

bonusSoul_single.tooltip: Souls awarded (after delay) when boss is defeated with no summons.

bonusSoul_multi.tooltip: Souls awarded to each player (after delay) when boss is defeated with summons.
