cumulateReset05:1.tooltip: If True, all cumulative points in this slot will be reset when the slot is actually dropped.

cumulateReset06:1.tooltip: If True, all cumulative points in this slot will be reset when the slot is actually dropped.

cumulateReset07:1.tooltip: If True, all cumulative points in this slot will be reset when the slot is actually dropped.

cumulateReset08:1.tooltip: If True, all cumulative points in this slot will be reset when the slot is actually dropped.

texId.tooltip: Texture ID of lens flare (texture name format is 'lensflare_XX'). -1 means disabled.

isFlare.tooltip: Flare if enabled, or 'ghost' if disabled.

enableRoll.tooltip: Allows lens flare texture to rotate with camera.

enableScale.tooltip: Allows lens flare texture to change scale with camera.

locateDistRate.tooltip: Relative position of lens flare between light source (0.0) and center of screen (1.0).

texScale.tooltip: Base scaling of lens flare texture.

colR.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of lens flare texture.

colG.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of lens flare texture.

colB.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of lens flare texture.

colA.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of lens flare texture.

lightDegRotX.tooltip: Rotation (X-axis) of visible light source (e.g. sun) that causes lens flares.

lightDegRotY.tooltip: Rotation (Y-axis) of visible light source (e.g. sun) that causes lens flares.

colR.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of visible light source (e.g. sun).

colG.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of visible light source (e.g. sun).

colB.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of visible light source (e.g. sun).

colA.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of visible light source (e.g. sun).

lightDist.tooltip: Distance of visible light source (e.g. sun). Not sure about the units.

colR_0.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 0.

colG_0.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 0.

colB_0.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 0.

colA_0.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 0.

colR_1.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 1.

colG_1.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 1.

colB_1.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 1.

colA_1.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 1.

colR_2.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 2.

colG_2.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 2.

colB_2.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 2.

colA_2.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of ambient (parallel) light source 2.

colR_u.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of ambient light of upward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly upward (e.g. floors) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

colG_u.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of ambient light of upward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly upward (e.g. floors) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

colB_u.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of ambient light of upward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly upward (e.g. floors) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

colA_u.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of ambient light of upward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly upward (e.g. floors) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

colR_d.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of ambient light of downward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly downward (e.g. ceilings) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

colG_d.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of ambient light of downward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly downward (e.g. ceilings) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

colB_d.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of ambient light of downward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly downward (e.g. ceilings) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

colA_d.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of ambient light of downward-facing surfaces. This has the largest effect for surfaces oriented exactly downward (e.g. ceilings) and decreases as a function of orientation until the surface is oriented sideways (e.g. walls).

degRotX_s.tooltip: Rotation (X-axis) of specular ambient (parallel) light source.

degRotY_s.tooltip: Rotation (Y-axis) of specular ambient (parallel) light source.

colR_s.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of specular ambient light source.

colG_s.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of specular ambient light source.

colB_s.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of specular ambient light source.

colA_s.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of specular ambient light source.

envDif_colR.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of base diffuse ambient light of surfaces.

envDif_colG.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of base diffuse ambient light of surfaces.

envDif_colB.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of base diffuse ambient light of surfaces.

envDif_colA.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of base diffuse ambient light of surfaces.

envSpc_colR.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of specular ambient light of surfaces.

envSpc_colG.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of specular ambient light of surfaces.

envSpc_colB.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of specular ambient light of surfaces.

envSpc_colA.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of specular ambient light of surfaces.

envDif.tooltip: Changing this has drastic effects on the diffuse ambient light.

envSpc_0.tooltip: Changing this has drastic effects on the specular ambient light.

envSpc_1.tooltip: Changing this has drastic effects on the specular ambient light.

envSpc_2.tooltip: Changing this has drastic effects on the specular ambient light.

envSpc_3.tooltip: Changing this has drastic effects on the specular ambient light.

distanceMul.tooltip: Magnification (0-100) of scattering light source distance.

sunR.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of scattering light source.

sunG.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of scattering light source.

sunB.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of scattering light source.

sunA.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of scattering light source.

lsHGg.tooltip: Coefficient of scattering direction, between -1 (backward) and 1 (forward).

lsBetaRay.tooltip: Coefficient determining how much light is lost to scattering (e.g. simulating amount of atmosphere).

lsBetaMie.tooltip: Coefficient determining how much light is scattered by larger particles (e.g. simulating dust/smoke).

blendCoef.tooltip: Coefficient determining the overall amount of scattering from 0 (no scattering) to 100 (max scattering).

reflectanceR.tooltip: Red channel (0-255) of the effect of the scattered light as it hits surfaces.

reflectanceG.tooltip: Green channel (0-255) of the effect of the scattered light as it hits surfaces.

reflectanceB.tooltip: Blue channel (0-255) of the effect of the scattered light as it hits surfaces.

reflectanceA.tooltip: Alpha channel (0-255) of the effect of the scattered light as it hits surfaces.

camDistTarget.tooltip: Distance maintained from target by camera in meters. (Default value is 4.)

rotRangeMinX.tooltip: Minimum angle of elevation (X-axis rotation) permitted for camera.

lockRotXShiftRatio.tooltip: 'Lock X-rotation shift ratio (0.0 to 1.0).' Unclear effect. Default value is 0.6.

chrOrgOffset_Y.tooltip: Vertical offset of camera target from character's base. Default value is 1.42.

chrLockRangeMaxRadius.tooltip: Maximum distance ('radius') of camera from character in meters. Default value is 15; only other value used is 7.

camFovY.tooltip: Vertical field of view of camera in degrees. Default value is 43. Never goes above 48 (Lost Izalith).

yesNoDialogMessageId.tooltip: Message displayed in yes/no dialog box to confirm use of spell. Requires the Yes/No menu type.

mp.tooltip: MP cost of spell. Unused in Dark Souls 1 (always zero).

stamina.tooltip: Stamina cost of spell. Always zero.

iconId.tooltip: Spell icon texture for inventory and equipped slot.

behaviorId.tooltip: Behavior triggered by spell. Never used.

mtrlItemId.tooltip: Good required for use. Never used (usability is handled in Shops parameters).

replaceMagicId.tooltip: Spell to replace 'when the state change matches'. Never used.

maxQuantity.tooltip: Number of spell casts. Note that some spells consume multiple casts per use (e.g. Firestorm).

heroPoint.tooltip: Soft humanity consumed when casting spell. Never used.

sfxVariationId.tooltip: Visual effect variation. (I believe this alters the animation ID used for casting.)

slotLength.tooltip: Number of attunement slots required to attune spell.

requirementIntellect.tooltip: Minimum intelligence required to cast spell.

requirementFaith.tooltip: Minimum faith required to cast spell.

analogDexiterityMin.tooltip: Dexterity value where casting speed starts to be affected (I think). This is always 20, but apparently speed isn't actually affected until dexterity is 35.

analogDexiterityMax.tooltip: Dexterity value where casting speed stops being further affected (I think). Always 45, which is consistent with the observed dexterity cap.

refCategory.tooltip: Determines if this spell triggers a Bullet or Special Effect. ('Default' is never used, but probably triggers an Attack, which is unlikely to be useful to you.)

spEffectCategory.tooltip: Determines what type of special effects affect the stats of this spell. (Vanilla game uses 3 for sorceries and pyromancies, and 4 for miracles.)

refType.tooltip: Basic animation type when casting spell. The Visual Effect Variation field further refines it.

opmeMenuType.tooltip: Menu activated (if any) when spell is cast. Only used by Homeward (Yes/No Dialog).

hasSpEffectType.tooltip: Determines 'the state change that needs to replace the spell ID'. Never used.

replaceCategory.tooltip: Determines which existing effects this spell will replace. Only used for a few spells.

useLimitCategory.tooltip: Only one special effect with this category can be active at once. Additional attempts to cast spells (or use goods) in this category will be prevented.

vowType0:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters with no covenant.

vowType1:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Way of White.

vowType2:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Princess's Guard.

vowType3:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Warriors of Sunlight.

vowType4:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Darkwraith covenant.

vowType5:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Path of the Dragon.

vowType6:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Gravelord Servants.

vowType7:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Forest Hunters.

enable_multi:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast while multiple players are together. Only disabled for Homeward in vanilla game.

enable_multi_only:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can ONLY be cast while multiple players are together. Always False.

isEnchant:1.tooltip: Indicates if this spell buffs your weapon.

isShieldEnchant:1.tooltip: Indicates if this spell buffs your shield.

enable_live:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by players who have revived to human.

enable_gray:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by players who have NOT revived to human.

enable_white:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by White Phantoms (summons). Only disabled for Homeward and the unused Escape Death miracle in vanilla game.

enable_black:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by Black Phantoms (invaders). Only disabled for Homeward and the unused Escape Death miracle in vanilla game.

disableOffline:1.tooltip: If True, this spell cannot be cast without a network connection. Always False.

castResonanceMagic:1.tooltip: If True, using this spell will create a resonance ring to help players in other worlds.

vowType8:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Blades of the Darkmoon.

vowType9:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in the Chaos Servant covenant.

vowType10:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in unused covenant 10.

vowType11:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in unused covenant 11.

vowType12:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in unused covenant 12.

vowType13:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in unused covenant 13.

vowType14:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in unused covenant 14.

vowType15:1.tooltip: Determines if this spell can be cast by characters in unused covenant 15.

a.tooltip: Alpha value of RGBA color (0-255). Higher means less transparent.

analogMoveParamId.tooltip: Movement settings for analog stick version of movement. (Unknown enum.)

behaviorVariationId.tooltip: Multiplied by 1000 and added to non-player behavior lookups (hitboxes, bullets) triggered by TAE.

aiThinkId.tooltip: Default AI ID. Overridden by AI ID field in Maps entry.

nameId.tooltip: Text ID for NPC name that appears attached to NPCs. Only works for invaders and summons.

turnVellocity.tooltip: Turning velocity of NPC. (Exact effect needs testing.)

hitHeight.tooltip: Height of NPC hitbox for collision.

hitRadius.tooltip: Radius of NPC hitbox for collision.

weight.tooltip: Weight of NPC. Probably has no effect (generall 100).

hitYOffset.tooltip: Vertical offset of NPC hitbox for collision.

mp.tooltip: Maximum MP of NPC. Not used in Dark Souls (generally zero).

getSoul.tooltip: Amount of souls (before NG+ scaling) rewarded when NPC is killed.

itemLotId_1.tooltip: First item lot triggered when NPC dies (set to -1 for no item lot).

itemLotId_2.tooltip: Second item lot triggered when NPC dies (set to -1 for no item lot).

itemLotId_3.tooltip: Third item lot triggered when NPC dies (set to -1 for no item lot).

itemLotId_4.tooltip: Fourth item lot triggered when NPC dies (set to -1 for no item lot).

itemLotId_5.tooltip: Fifth item lot triggered when NPC dies (set to -1 for no item lot).

itemLotId_6.tooltip: Sixth item lot triggered when NPC dies (set to -1 for no item lot).

humanityLotId.tooltip: Starting flag of counter for awarding random humanity (I think). Only used by a few enemies, such as Hollows and Mass of Souls.

spEffectID0.tooltip: First passive special effect that is active on NPC.  This slot is generally reserved for effects in the 5300-5337 range, which modify enemy damage animations (e.g. so bosses stagger less).

spEffectID1.tooltip: Second passive special effect that is active on NPC.  This slot is generally reserved for effects in the 5360-5364 range, which further modify enemy damage animations based on poise.

spEffectID2.tooltip: Third passive special effect that is active on NPC.  This slot is generally reserved for effects in the 90000-91111 range, which determine status effect immunities. From left to right, the four binary digits represent poison, toxic, bleed, and curse. 0 means the NPC is immune to that status, and 1 means they are not immune (though their resistance could be any value).

spEffectID3.tooltip: Fourth passive special effect that is active on NPC.  This slot is generally reserved for effects in the 80000-81111 range, which determine immunities to effects that apparently never made it into the game ('remnant', 'absorption', 'fascination', and 'ineffective').

spEffectID4.tooltip: Fifth passive special effect that is active on NPC.  This slot is generally reserved for 'levelling' effects in the 7000-7015 range, which scale enemy stats according to the map they are found in.

spEffectID5.tooltip: Sixth passive special effect that is active on NPC.  Used for miscellaneous effects, such as elemental resistance or immunity, animation offset effects, the black phantom effect (7100), etc.

spEffectID6.tooltip: Seventh passive special effect that is active on NPC.  Used for miscellaneous effects, such as elemental resistance or immunity, animation offset effects, the black phantom effect (7100), etc.

spEffectID7.tooltip: Eighth passive special effect that is active on NPC.  This slot is generally reserved for effect 71100, 71110, or 71111. The fourth binary digit determines if the NPC uses the 'immortal system'; the third binary digit is unknown. Darkwraiths, Hollows, Humanity Phantoms, and Armored Tusks are some examples of the few NPCs that use 71111; most others use 71110, except bosses.

GameClearSpEffectID.tooltip: Passive special effect that is only applied to the NPC in NG+ and beyond, which are taken from the range 7401-7415.

physGuardCutRate.tooltip: Percentage reduction in physical damage taken while NPC is guarding.

magGuardCutRate.tooltip: Percentage reduction in magic damage taken while NPC is guarding.

fireGuardCutRate.tooltip: Percentage reduction in fire damage taken while NPC is guarding.

thunGuardCutRate.tooltip: Percentage reduction in lightning damage taken while NPC is guarding.

animIdOffset.tooltip: Offset added to animation requests (e.g. from AI script or event script). If the offset animation is missing, the original will be used.

partsDamageRate1.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 1 of NPC model.

partsDamageRate2.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 2 of NPC model.

partsDamageRate3.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 3 of NPC model.

partsDamageRate4.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 4 of NPC model.

partsDamageRate5.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 5 of NPC model.

partsDamageRate6.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 6 of NPC model.

partsDamageRate7.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 7 of NPC model.

partsDamageRate8.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by part 8 of NPC model.

weakPartsDamageRate.tooltip: Multiplier for damage taken by weak parts of NPC model.

superArmorRecoverCorrection.tooltip: Change to poise recovery rate. Only the Chained Prisoner uses a non-zero value in vanilla(-0.2).

superArmorBrakeKnockbackDist.tooltip: Stagger knockback distance when NPC's poise is broken.

staminaRecoverBaseVel.tooltip: Base speed of NPC's stamina recovery.

def_phys.tooltip: Base defense applied to all physical attacks.

def_slash.tooltip: Base defense added against slashing physical attacks.

def_blow.tooltip: Base defense added against striking physical attacks.

def_thrust.tooltip: Base defense added against thrusting physical attacks.

def_mag.tooltip: Base defense added against magic attacks.

def_fire.tooltip: Base defense added against fire attacks.

def_thunder.tooltip: Base defense added against lightning attacks.

defFlickPower.tooltip: Determines how severely an attacker is repelled when they fail to break this NPC's poise. The Armored Tusk and Chained Prisoner have very high values (50-60), but most NPCs have 0.

ghostModelId.tooltip: Model to be used when this quest-related NPC appears as a ghost to other players. Defaults to -1 for almost all standard enemies, which means they do not appear as a ghost to others.

guardAngle.tooltip: Zero for every NPC except the Phalanx Hollow (20).

superArmorDurability.tooltip: Maximum poise of character. Poise is reduced when attacked, but quickly refills. If reduced to zero, the character will be staggered.

normalChangeTexChrId.tooltip: Unknown. Used for only some NPCs, where it is generally set to a number close to the NPC's character model ID.

dropType.tooltip: Determines appearance of dropped items. 0 means the item appears to glow faintly from inside the NPC's body (e.g. Rat, Mushroom Child/Parent, Ent) and 1 means the item is a clear white orb just like regular treasure on corpses (most NPCs).

knockbackParamId.tooltip: Knockback parameters were abandoned after Demons' Souls. A param table for Knockback is still present but is not accessible in the GUI.

fallDamageDump.tooltip: Percentage of fall damage to ignore.

staminaGuardDef.tooltip: Always set to zero in the game, but presumably, increasing it will reduce the amount of stamina lost when this NPC blocks an attack.

pcAttrB.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

pcAttrW.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

pcAttrL.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

pcAttrR.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

areaAttrB.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

areaAttrW.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

areaAttrL.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

areaAttrR.tooltip: Like a remnant of World Tendency. Always set to zero.

mpRecoverBaseVel.tooltip: Unknown effect, likely none. Set to zero for NPC parts (tails and Hydra heads) and 10 for everyone else.

flickDamageCutRate.tooltip: Unknown effect, but it is set to zero for most enemies, 50 for very heavy enemies like Great Stone Knights and Titanite Demons, and 100 for Mimics.

teamType.tooltip: 0: enemy, 1: boss, 2: ally, 6: unused, 7: white phantom

partsDamageType.tooltip: Unknown. Seems to be set to 1 for most enemies with multiple parts (Sentinels, Quelaag, Seath, Gaping Dragon), but not all of them (Bell Gargoyles), and 0 otherwise.

maxUndurationAng.tooltip: Unknown effect, but it is generally set to 30 for all four-legged enemies, and 0 for all others.

guardLevel.tooltip: Set to 4 for enemies who can guard (including Manus), except Giant Skeletons, who have a value of 3. All other NPCs have zero.

burnSfxType.tooltip: Set to 1 for Slimes and Undead Dragons, and 0 for everyone else.

sfxSize.tooltip: Set to 2 for very large enemies, 1 for large enemies, and 0 otherwise.

hitStopType.tooltip: Set to 1 or 2 for most bosses/tough enemies, and 0 otherwise. Likely related to AI triggers.

ladderEndChkOffsetTop.tooltip: Not something you want to mess with.

ladderEndChkOffsetLow.tooltip: Not something you want to mess with.

disableRespawn:1.tooltip: Prevents character from respawning when you rest at a bonfire, though they will still respawn when you die or the map is de-loaded unless they are disabled by an event script.

isWeakSaint:1.tooltip: True for skeletons and friends, but not sure how it is actually used to disable their reanimation by Necromancers.

isWeakA:1.tooltip: True for all Gods and most NPCs in Anor Londo.

isWeakB:1.tooltip: True for Darkwraiths, Primordial Serpents, and the Four Kings, but not Manus.

vowType:3.tooltip: Effects unknown. Set to 1 (Way of White) for Andre and 0 for everyone else.

disableInitializeDead:1.tooltip: True for bosses and non-respawning enemies that are disabled in event scripts, but its effects are unknown.

battleGoalID.tooltip: Battle goal ID used to look up battle Lua script.

nearDist.tooltip: Distance considered to be close range by this NPC (for scripts).

midDist.tooltip: Distance considered to be medium range by this NPC (for scripts).

farDist.tooltip: Distance considered to be long range by this NPC (for scripts).

outDist.tooltip: Distance beyond which the NPC will not attempt to fight.

BackHomeLife_OnHitEneWal.tooltip: Retreat goal time when touching an 'enemy wall' that blocks the NPC's path. (Not clear what an 'enemy wall' means. Almost always set to 5 (rarely 6).

goalID_ToCaution.tooltip: Lua script to use when NPC's AI enters the 'Caution' state (I think). Requires a CautionGoalAction value of 4. Used only by Hawkeye Gough (411000); zero otherwise.

idAttackCannotMove.tooltip: Animation to use if the NPC gets stuck on a destructible object. Usually 3000 (basic attack).

goalID_ToFind.tooltip: Lua script to use when NPC's AI enters the 'Search' state (I think). Requires a SearchGoalAction value of 4. Not used by any vanilla NPC (all zero).

callHelp_ActionAnimId.tooltip: Animation to play when responding to a call for help. Usually set to -1 for NPCs who can reply to calls for help, which I assume means no animation is played. Set to 0 for NPCs who ignore calls for help.

callHelp_CallActionId.tooltip: Animation to play when calling for help. Only used by Female Ghost (7300) and Male Ghost and summons (-1). I assume -1 means no animation is played. Set to 0 for all other NPCs.

ear_soundcut_dist.tooltip: Internal description: 'Distance to reduce the size of the sound source. Sounds less than this distance will not be heard.' Set to 1 for Bloatheads and Bloathead Sorcerers and 0 for everyone else.

maxBackhomeDist.tooltip: Absolute furthest the NPC can travel from their nest before retreating, in or out of battle. (Argument of internal GOAL function 'COMMON_SetBattleActLogic()'.) Usually set to about 50% more than BattleRetreatDistance.

backhomeDist.tooltip: Furthest distance the NPC can travel from their nest before retreating in battle. (Argument of internal GOAL function 'COMMON_SetBattleActLogic()'.)

backhomeBattleDist.tooltip: Target distance at which battle mode is triggered while the enemy is retreating. (Argument of internal GOAL function 'COMMON_SetBattleActLogic()'.)

nonBattleActLife.tooltip: Lifespan of Acts outside of battle. Set to 10 for Bloatheads and Bloathead Sorcerers, 0 for Priscilla's Tail and the Bed of Chaos bug, and 5 for everyone else. (Argument of internal GOAL function 'COMMON_SetBattleActLogic()'.)

BackHome_LookTargetTime.tooltip: Time that NPC will search for a lost target before retreating (I think). Set to 20 for everyone except the Bounding Demons of Izalith, who have a value of 0.

BackHome_LookTargetDist.tooltip: Distance that NPC will search for a lost target before retreating (I think). Set to 20 for everyone except the Bounding Demons of Izalith, who have a value of 0.

SightTargetForgetTime.tooltip: Time to forget about sighted targets. Usually set to 600.

SoundTargetForgetTime.tooltip: Time to forget about heard targets. Usually set to 300.

BattleStartDist.tooltip: Target distance at which battle mode is triggered.

callHelp_MyPeerId.tooltip: Determines which calls for help this NPC will respond to (must match caller's HelpCallGroupID). Only 0 (no ID) and 1 are used.

callHelp_CallPeerId.tooltip: HelpGroupID value of NPCs who should respond to calls for help by this NPC. Only 0 (no ID) and 1 are used.

targetSys_DmgEffectRate.tooltip: Internal description: 'Get damage rate (%) for target system evaluation information.' Set to 0 for summons, phantoms, and the Parasitic Wall Hugger, and 100 for everyone else.

TeamAttackEffectivity.tooltip: Value from 0 to 100 that determines the number of simultaneous attacks made by this NPC's team. Higher values mean that less members of this team can participate in attacks at the same time. (I presume that the total score of attacking team members cannot exceed 100.) Usually set to 25 or 100.

eye_angX.tooltip: Angular width of sight field in degrees.

eye_angY.tooltip: Angular height of sight field in degrees.

ear_angX.tooltip: Angular width of hearing field in degrees.

ear_angY.tooltip: Angular height of hearing field in degrees.

callHelp_CallValidMinDistTarget.tooltip: Minimum distance from AI target for help call to be made. Always zero.

callHelp_CallValidRange.tooltip: Maximum distance of friend to receive help call from this NPC. Set to 50 for both Male and Female Ghosts, and 0 for everyone else.

callHelp_ForgetTimeByArrival.tooltip: Time until call for help is forgotten by responder.

callHelp_MinWaitTime.tooltip: Internal description: 'Minimum time for response goal at first waiting goal'. Units are in tenths of a second. Only used for Male Ghosts (20).

callHelp_MaxWaitTime.tooltip: Internal description: 'Maximum time for response goal at first waiting goal'. Units are in tenths of a second. Only used for Female Ghosts (40).

goalAction_ToCaution.tooltip: Type of action taken when AI enters the 'Caution' state.

goalAction_ToFind.tooltip: Type of action taken when AI enters the 'Search' state.

callHelp_ReplyBehaviorType.tooltip: Set to 0 for NPCs who do not reply to calls for help and 1 for NPCs who do.

disablePathMove.tooltip: If 1, this NPC will ignore navmesh when moving. True for Ghosts and enemies that don't move at all.

skipArrivalVisibleCheck.tooltip: Internal description: 'If enabled, arrival determination is performed even if the line of sightis not passed.' True only for Hawkeye Gough.

thinkAttr_doAdmirer.tooltip: Internal description: 'Thought attribute: when enabled, it plays the role of a wrap.' I don'tknow exactly what that means, but this is likely important for something. Enabled for Soulmassand Pursuers, non-giant Rats, Infested Ghouls, Mushrooms, most Hollows (not archers), MaleGhosts, normal Skeletons and Skeleton Beasts, and Pisaca.

enableNaviFlg_Edge:1.tooltip: If True, this NPC will pursue targets off navmesh edges (survivable falls).

enableNaviFlg_LargeSpace:1.tooltip: If True, this NPC can enter navmesh regions flagged as 'large spaces'.

enableNaviFlg_Ladder:1.tooltip: If True, this NPC will use ladders.

enableNaviFlg_Hole:1.tooltip: If True, this NPC can fall into navmesh holes.

enableNaviFlg_Door:1.tooltip: If True, this NPC can go through doors (but not necessarily open closed doors).

enableNaviFlg_InSideWall:1.tooltip: If True, this NPC can go through walls (i.e. ignores navmesh walls).

hp.tooltip: Amount of damage object can take before it is destroyed. (Set to -1 for invulnerability.)

defense.tooltip: Minimum attack power required to damage object. Attacks with less power than this will deal no damage.

extRefTexId.tooltip: Internal description: 'mAA / mAA_????.tpf (-1: None) (AA: Area number)'.

materialId.tooltip: Treated the same as floor material. (Set to -1 to use default.)

animBreakIdMax.tooltip: Upper limit of range of destruction animations, which seem to always start at 0.

isCamHit:1.tooltip: If True, the camera will collide with this object.

isBreakByPlayerCollide:1.tooltip: If True, the player will break the object just by touching it.

isAnimBreak:1.tooltip: If True, the object will use an animation when destroyed rather than using physics-based destruction.

isPenetrationBulletHit:1.tooltip: If True, the object can be damaged by Bullets with target-piercing enabled.

isChrHit:1.tooltip: If False, characters will pass through the object (e.g. branches).

isAttackBacklash:1.tooltip: If True, attacks will bounce off the object as though it were a wall.

isDisableBreakForFirstAppear:1.tooltip: If True, the object cannot be destroyed when the player first spawns.

isAnimPauseOnRemoPlay:1.tooltip: If True, object animation will not play in cutscenes.

isDamageNoHit:1.tooltip: If True, all damage to the object will be prevented. (Not sure if this is the same effet as settings its HP to -1.)

isMoveObj:1.tooltip: If True, this object can move.

breakSfxId.tooltip: Sound effect played upon destruction. (Set to -1 to use default value, which is apparently 80.)

actionEnableMsgId.tooltip: Message displayed in dialog box that prompts action (e.g. 'Open').

actionFailedMsgId.tooltip: Message displayed in dialog box upon failed action (e.g. 'It's locked').

spQualifiedPassEventFlag.tooltip: Action will always be successful if this flag is enabled.

validDist.tooltip: Maximum distance from action model point at which the object action will be prompted.

playerAnimId.tooltip: Animation played by a player character when they successfully activate the object.

chrAnimId.tooltip: Animation played by a non-player character when they successfully activate the object.

objDummyId.tooltip: Model point that specifies where the action occurs on the object (for snapping the player and distance check).

objAnimId.tooltip: Animation played by the object when it is successfully activated.

validPlayerAngle.tooltip: Maximum angle between the character's forward direction and the direction to the object action point for the action prompt to appear.

validObjAngle.tooltip: Maximum angle between the object's forward direction and the direction to the player for the action prompt to appear.

chrSorbType.tooltip: Type of method used to snap the character to the object before animations are played.

eventKickTiming.tooltip: I believe this is the delay between successful object activation and the outgoing 'success' trigger used by game events.

dwindleBegin.tooltip: Distance at which player's point light begins to fade.

dwindleEnd.tooltip: Distance at which player's point light finishes fading and disappears entirely.

physicsDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier for physical defense at this upgrade level.

magicDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier for magic defense at this upgrade level.

fireDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier for fire defense at this upgrade level.

thunderDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier for lightning defense at this upgrade level.

slashDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier for slash defense at this upgrade level.

blowDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier for strike defense at this upgrade level.

thrustDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier for thrust defense at this upgrade level.

resistPoisonRate.tooltip: Multiplier for poison resistance at this upgrade level.

resistDiseaseRate.tooltip: Multiplier for toxic resistance at this upgrade level.

resistBloodRate.tooltip: Multiplier for bleed resistance at this upgrade level.

resistCurseRate.tooltip: Multiplier for curse resistance at this upgrade level.

residentSpEffectId1.tooltip: Special effect granted to wearer (first of three).

residentSpEffectId2.tooltip: Special effect granted to wearer (second of three).

residentSpEffectId3.tooltip: Special effect granted to wearer (third of three).

physicsAtkRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing physical damage (of any type).

magicAtkRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing magic damage.

fireAtkRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing fire damage.

thunderAtkRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing lightning damage.

staminaAtkRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the amount of damage dealt to targets' stamina.

saWeaponAtkRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the amount of damage dealt to targets' poise. Never used.

saDurabilityRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to wielder's poise while using (attacking/blocking with?) weapon. Never used.

correctStrengthRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to strength scaling of this weapon.

correctAgilityRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to dexterity scaling of this weapon.

correctMagicRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to intelligence scaling of this weapon.

correctFaithRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to faith scaling of this weapon.

physicsGuardCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of physical damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

magicGuardCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of magic damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

fireGuardCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of fire damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

thunderGuardCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of lightning damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

poisonGuardResistRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of poison damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

diseaseGuardResistRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of toxic damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

bloodGuardResistRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of bleed damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

curseGuardResistRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of curse damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

staminaGuardDefRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the percentage of stamina damage blocked by this weapon/shield.

spEffectId1.tooltip: Special effect applied to struck target (slot 0). Overrides slot 0 of base weapon parameters.

spEffectId2.tooltip: Special effect applied to struck target (slot 1). Overrides slot 1 of base weapon parameters.

spEffectId3.tooltip: Special effect applied to struck target (slot 2). Overrides slot 2 of base weapon parameters.

residentSpEffectId1.tooltip: Special effect granted to character with weapon equipped (slot 0). Overrides slot 0 of base weapon parameters.

residentSpEffectId2.tooltip: Special effect granted to character with weapon equipped (slot 1). Overrides slot 1 of base weapon parameters.

residentSpEffectId3.tooltip: Special effect granted to character with weapon equipped (slot 2). Overrides slot 2 of base weapon parameters.

materialSetId.tooltip: Value to be added to Upgrade Materials field in base weapon parameters.

reinforcementLevel.tooltip: Reinforcement level of weapon. (Added in DSR)

densityRatio.tooltip: Density of cast shadow (0-100), where 100 is the darkest.

beginDist.tooltip: Minimum distance (m) at which shadows are cast. A value of 0 means the camera's near-clip plane is used.

endDist.tooltip: Maximum distance (m) at which shadows are cast.

calibulateFar.tooltip: Shorten the shadow end distance by this distance when facing the light source direction.

fadeBeginDist.tooltip: Shadow starts fading at this distance.

fadeDist.tooltip: Distance (after start distance) until shadow is fully faded.

persedDepthOffset.tooltip: Depth offset for shadows. With negative values, self-shadows are less likely to occur.

gradFactor.tooltip: Negative values weaken the shadow map, positive values strengthen it.

shadowVolumeDepth.tooltip: Increase this value to cast shadows on tall objects such as buildings.

mtrlId.tooltip: Good that must be possessed for item to be listed. Used to control appearance of spells in attunement menu.

eventFlag.tooltip: Flag value that holds the count of this item that have been sold already.

sellQuantity.tooltip: Quantity of this item initially available to be sold. Set to -1 for infinite quantity.

shopType.tooltip: Determines if this is a standard shop menu or the spell attunement menu.

equipType.tooltip: Type of item listed in menu.

iconId.tooltip: Icon that appears in HUD under stamina bar while special effect is active. Set to -1 for no icon.

conditionHp.tooltip: Special effect will only take effect if character's current HP is less than or equal to this percentage (from 0 to 100). Set to -1 for no HP condition.

effectEndurance.tooltip: Duration of special effect. Set to 0 for an effect that occurs for only one frame (e.g. to award souls) or to -1 for an effect that will last until specifically removed or its source is lost (e.g. rings).

motionInterval.tooltip: Time (in seconds) between applications of the special effect, while active. Set to higher values to have the effect apply less frequently. Set to 0 to have it occur every frame.

maxMpRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to maximum MP. (Unused in Dark Souls; does NOT refer to spell usages.)

slashDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to incoming slashing physical damage.

blowDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to incoming striking physical damage.

thrustDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to incoming thrusting physical damage.

neutralDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to incoming neutral physical damage.

magicDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to incoming magic damage.

fireDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to incoming fire damage.

thunderDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to incoming lightning damage.

physicsAttackRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing physical damage (of any type).

magicAttackRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing magic damage.

fireAttackRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing fire damage.

thunderAttackRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to outgoing lightning damage.

physicsAttackPowerRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's physical attack power (of any type).

magicAttackPowerRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's magic attack power.

fireAttackPowerRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's fire attack power.

thunderAttackPowerRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's lightning attack power.

physicsAttackPower.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract fromcharacter's physical attack power (of any type).

magicAttackPower.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract fromcharacter's magic attack power.

fireAttackPower.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract fromcharacter's fire attack power.

thunderAttackPower.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract fromcharacter's lightning attack power.

physicsDiffenceRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's physical defense (all types).

magicDiffenceRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's magic defense.

fireDiffenceRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's fire defense.

thunderDiffenceRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's lightning defense.

physicsDiffence.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract from character's physical defense.

magicDiffence.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract from character's magic defense.

fireDiffence.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract from character's fire defense.

thunderDiffence.tooltip: Value to add to or subtract from character's lightning defense.

NoGuardDamageRate.tooltip: Multiplier to use instead of usual multiplier if character is not guarding. (Always set to 0 in vanilla game, which must deactivate it. Only an educated guess that it refers to incoming damage, not outgoing.)

vitalSpotChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier to use instead of usual multiplier if character is hit in a weak spot. (Always set to -1 in vanilla game, which deactivates it. Only an educated guess that it affects incoming damage.)

normalSpotChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier to use instead of usual multiplier if character is *not* hit in a weak spot. (Always set to -1 in vanilla game, which deactivates it. Only an educated guess that it affects incoming damage.)

maxHpChangeRate.tooltip: Appears to be an unused variant of MaxHPMultiplier. Always set to 0.

behaviorId.tooltip: Behavior ID to trigger (which can in turn trigger an Attack or Bullet) whenever special effect is applied. Set to -1 to use no behavior.

changeHpRate.tooltip: Percentage reduction of maximum HP (from 0 to 100). Negative values (to -100) will restore that percentage instead. Applied every time the special effect updates.

changeHpPoint.tooltip: HP value to subtract (if positive) or add (if negative) to character's current HP on every update of the special effect.

changeMpRate.tooltip: Percentage reduction of maximum MP (from 0 to 100). Negative values (to -100) will restore that percentage instead. Applied every time the special effect updates. (Unused in Dark Souls 1.)

changeMpPoint.tooltip: MP value to subtract (if positive) or add (if negative) to character's current MP on every update of the special effect. (Unused in Dark Souls 1.)

mpRecoverChangeSpeed.tooltip: Points added to or subtracted from MP recovery formula. (Unused in Dark Souls 1.)

changeStaminaRate.tooltip: Percentage reduction of maximum stamina (from 0 to 100). Negative values (to -100) will restore that percentage instead. Applied every time the special effect updates.

changeStaminaPoint.tooltip: Stamina value to subtract (if positive) or add (if negative) to character's current stamina on every update of the special effect.

staminaRecoverChangeSpeed.tooltip: Points added to or subtracted from stamina recovery formula. I believe this affects the amount of stamina restored every second. (For reference, a Green Blossom adds 40 points.)

magicEffectTimeChange.tooltip: Name suggests this changes the duration of magic effects, but it is never used (always zero).

insideDurability.tooltip: Amount of durability to subtract (if positive) or add (if negative) to current durability on every update of the special effect. The equipment affected is determined by...

maxDurability.tooltip: Amount of durability to subtract (if positive) or add (if negative) to the character's maximum durability while the special effect is active. The equipment affected is determined by...

staminaAttackRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the amount of damage dealt to targets' stamina.

poizonAttackPower.tooltip: Amount of poison damage (in units of resistance) added to the character on every update. Negative values will heal poison damage instead (e.g. Purple Moss Clump). Unclear how this distinguishes between reducing build-up and actually healing the status.

registIllness.tooltip: Amount of toxic damage (in units of resistance) added to the character on every update. Negative values will heal toxic damage instead (e.g. Blooming Purple Moss Clump). Unclear how this distinguishes between reducing build-up and actually healing the status.

registBlood.tooltip: Amount of bleed damage (in units of resistance) added to the character on every update. Negative values will heal bleed damage instead (e.g. Blood-Red Moss Clump). Unclear how this distinguishes between reducing build-up and actually healing the status.

registCurse.tooltip: Amount of curse damage (in units of resistance) added to the character on every update. Negative values will heal curse damage instead (e.g. Purging Stone). Unclear how this distinguishes between reducing build-up and actually healing the status.

fallDamageRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to amount of fall damage taken by character. Cannot prevent lethal falls.

soulRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the amount of souls received when enemies or bosses are killed.

equipWeightChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the character's maximum equip load.

allItemWeightChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to how much the character can carry, equipped or not. Seems to have no effect in Dark Souls 1.

soul.tooltip: Amount of souls received (if positive) or taken away (if negative) every time the special effect is updated.

animIdOffset.tooltip: Override default animation ID offset of character, which can change their animation set temporarily.

haveSoulRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the amount of souls given to the player when they kill this character (e.g. enemies in NG+).

targetPriority.tooltip: Value added to or subtract from this character's priority in the target queue. Higher priority means they are more likely to be targeted by enemies.

sightSearchEnemyCut.tooltip: Percentage reduction in enemy sight (from 0 to 100) when looking for this character. Not sure if negative values can be used to make this character *more* visible.

hearingSearchEnemyCut.tooltip: Percentage reduction in enemy hearing (from 0 to 100) when looking for this character. Not sure if negative values can be used to make this character *more* audible.

grabityRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to all of this character's animations. Values other than 1 can lead to cool but potentially glitchy behavior (e.g. desynchronized grab animations and missed collision).

registPoizonChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's maximum poison resistance.

registIllnessChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's maximum toxic resistance.

registBloodChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's maximum bleed resistance.

registCurseChangeRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to character's maximum curse resistance.

soulStealRate.tooltip: Internal description says 'defense against HP when NPCs are robbed by soul steal'. Probably unused.

lifeReductionRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to the duration of the effect specified in EffectDurationMultiplierType. Used only by Hawkeye Gough to reduce poison and toxic duration in vanilla game.

hpRecoverRate.tooltip: Multiplier applied to any increase in character's current HP.

replaceSpEffectId.tooltip: Special effect to apply to character automatically when this special effect ends (if not terminated manually by an event).

cycleOccurrenceSpEffectId.tooltip: Special effect to apply to character every time this special effect updates (e.g. Symbol of Avarice HP reduction).

atkOccurrenceSpEffectId.tooltip: Special effect to apply to any target hit by an attack.  WARNING: This will not trigger unless SpecialStateIndex is set to 152 (Rotten Pine Resin effect), which will in turn cause your weapon to glow purple unless the visual effect is disabled.

guardStaminaCutRate.tooltip: Values larger than 1 mean *less* stamina is used when blocking.

rayCastPassedTime.tooltip: Internal description says 'Gaze passing: activation time (milliseconds).' Likely unused.

changeSuperArmorPoint.tooltip: Amount added (if positive) or subtracted (if negative) from character's poise.

bowDistRate.tooltip: Percentage change (from 0 to 100) in bow range. Requires SpecialStateIndex BowBoostRange (168) to work.

spCategory.tooltip: Category of special effect. This effect will override (i.e. cancel out) all other active effects with the same category when it is added.

categoryPriority.tooltip: Priority ordering for special effect to be applied on each update (lower values are updated first).

saveCategory.tooltip: Determines automatic game saving behavior (used for status ailments only). Set to -1 for no saving.

changeMagicSlot.tooltip: Increase (positive) or decrease (negative) number of attunement slots available.

changeMiracleSlot.tooltip: Miracle slots are not even separate from other magic slots, so this is likely an abandoned field.

heroPointDamage.tooltip: Damage applied to soft humanity count. Negative values will add soft humanity.

defFlickPower.tooltip: Value added to or subtracted from defense against riposte attacks.

flickDamageCutRate.tooltip: Multiplier to use instead of usual multiplier on incoming (I assume) riposte attacks. Never used.

bloodDamageRate.tooltip: Percentage of incoming bleed damage received (usually 100).

dmgLv_None.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of NoImpact level.

dmgLv_S.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Small impact level.

dmgLv_M.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Medium impact level.

dmgLv_L.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Large impact level.

dmgLv_BlowM.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Blowoff impact level.

dmgLv_Push.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Push impact level.

dmgLv_Strike.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Strike impact level.

dmgLv_BlowS.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Blow impact level.

dmgLv_Min.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Minimal impact level.

dmgLv_Uppercut.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of Launch impact level.

dmgLv_BlowLL.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of BlowBackward impact level.

dmgLv_Breath.tooltip: Impact level that will occur instead of BreathBurn impact level.

atkAttribute.tooltip: Attack type attached to hits while special effect is active.

spAttribute.tooltip: Element attached to hits while special effect is active.

stateInfo.tooltip: Hard-coded special state to use. Also determines visual effect from Special Effect Visuals table.

wepParamChange.tooltip: Weapon category that is affected by special effect.

moveType.tooltip: Determines how movement is affected. (Does not correspond to Movement param entries.)

lifeReductionType.tooltip: Type of effect whose duration is affected by EffectDurationMultiplier. Known values: 2 = poison, 5 = toxic.

throwCondition.tooltip: Determines how throws are affected while special effect is active. Values still unknown (rarely used).

addBehaviorJudgeId_condition.tooltip: Unclear; used only to manage the Hydra as more heads are cut off. All other values are -1.

addBehaviorJudgeId_add.tooltip: Always zero. Unknown effect. Internal description suggests that this is a constant added to all behavior judge IDs (from TAE) issued by character.

effectTargetGhost:1.tooltip: Effect will target phantoms (white or black).

effectTargetAttacker:1.tooltip: Effect will target character when they attack (e.g. HP drain).

dispIconNonactive:1.tooltip: Display icon even when special effect is inactive (not sure what that means). Never enabled.

useSpEffectEffect:1.tooltip: Use visual effect from Special Effect Visuals table (indexed by Special State field).

bAdjustMagicAblity:1.tooltip: If True, special effect damage will be scaled by character intelligence (I believe).

bAdjustFaithAblity:1.tooltip: If True, special effect damage will be scaled by character faith (I believe).

bGameClearBonus:1.tooltip: If True, this effect will be applied multiple times depending on the NG+ cycle (I think).

magParamChange:1.tooltip: If True, multipliers will be applied to magic attacks.

miracleParamChange:1.tooltip: If True, multipliers will be applied to miracle attacks.

requestSOS:1.tooltip: Used only by White Sign Soapstone.

requestBlackSOS:1.tooltip: Used only by Red Sign Soapstone.

requestForceJoinBlackSOS:1.tooltip: Used only be (Cracked) Red Eye Orb.

requestKickSession:1.tooltip: Not used by any item. Likely kicks all clients out of your world.

requestLeaveSession:1.tooltip: Used only by Black Separation Crystal.

requestNpcInveda:1.tooltip: Used only by Black Eye Orb (Lautrec quest and cut Shiva quest).

noDead:1.tooltip: If True, character cannot die. Never used in vanilla game.

bCurrHPIndependeMaxHP:1.tooltip: If True, changes to maximum HP will not affect current HP (unless it must be reduced to new maximum).

corrosionIgnore:1.tooltip: If True, character will ignore corrosion damage to durability. Used only by Demon's Souls junk.

sightSearchCutIgnore:1.tooltip: If True, character will ignore any changes to their sight range from other special effects. Used only by Demon's Souls junk.

hearingSearchCutIgnore:1.tooltip: If True, character will ignore any changes to their hearing range from other special effects. Used only by Demon's Souls junk.

antiMagicIgnore:1.tooltip: If True, character will ignore any special effect that attempts to disable their magic. Used only by Demon's Souls junk.

grabityIgnore:1.tooltip: Ignore gravity. (Not sure if this actually works.)

enableCharm:1.tooltip: Not sure if this refers to the Alluring Skull. May not work at all.

enableLifeTime:1.tooltip: Internal description: 'Is the life extended when setting a flag by TAE?'. Effect unknown. Used by Dragon Head and Torso Stones and some internal summon-related effects.

hasTarget : 1.tooltip: For unused 'evil eye' mechanics, probably a Demon's Souls remnant.

isFireDamageCancel:1.tooltip: Immune to fire damage. Never enabled, and may not actually work. Needs testing.

isExtendSpEffectLife:1.tooltip: If True, this special effect will be affected by special state (193), i.e. the effect used by the vanilla Lingering Dragoncrest Ring, that extends effect durations.

requestLeaveColiseumSession:1.tooltip: Used only by Purple Coward's Crystal.

vowType0:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters with no covenant.

vowType1:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Way of White covenant.

vowType2:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Princess's Guard covenant.

vowType3:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Warriors of Sunlight covenant.

vowType4:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Darkwraith covenant.

vowType5:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Path of the Dragon covenant.

vowType6:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Gravelord Servant covenant.

vowType7:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Forest Hunters covenant.

vowType8:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Blades of the Darkmoon covenant.

vowType9:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in the Chaos Servants covenant.

vowType10:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in unused covenant.

vowType11:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in unused covenant.

vowType12:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in unused covenant.

vowType13:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in unused covenant.

vowType14:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in unused covenant.

vowType15:1.tooltip: Determines if this special effect will affect characters in unused covenant.

midstSfxId.tooltip: Ongoing visual effect for special effect. -1 is no effect.

midstSeId.tooltip: Ongoing sound effect for special effect. -1 is no effect.

initSfxId.tooltip: One-off visual effect when special effect begins. -1 is no effect.

initSeId.tooltip: One-off sound effect when special effect begins. -1 is no effect. (Does not appear to work.)

finishSfxId.tooltip: One-off visual effect when special effect ends. -1 is no effect.

finishSeId.tooltip: One-off sound effect when special effect ends. -1 is no effect. (Does not appear to work.)

camouflageBeginDist.tooltip: Closest distance at which effect is disabled.

camouflageEndDist.tooltip: Furthest distance at which effect is disabled.

transformProtectorId.tooltip: Transformation armor ID. Unknown effect. -1 is no armor.

midstDmyId.tooltip: Model point where ongoing effects are centered. -1 is model root.

initDmyId.tooltip: Model point where initial effect is centered. -1 is model root.

finishDmyId.tooltip: Model point where finish effect is centered. -1 is model root.

effectType.tooltip: Type of effect. Enum not yet mapped.

soulParamIdForWepEnchant.tooltip: Internal description: 'Soul Param ID for weapon enchantment.' Enum not yet mapped.

playCategory.tooltip: Only one effect in each category can be active at once (determined by PlaybackPriority).

playPriority.tooltip: Only the lowest-numbered-priority effect in each PlaybackCategory will be active at once.

existEffectForLarge:1.tooltip: Indicates if a large version of the effect exists.

existEffectForSoul:1.tooltip: Indicates if a 'soul version' of the effect exists.

effectInvisibleAtCamouflage:1.tooltip: Indicates if the effect should be invisible when hidden (unclear exactly what this means).

useCamouflage:1.tooltip: I believe this determines if the hiding range fields are actually used.

addMapAreaBlockOffset:1.tooltip: If enabled, the three-digit area/block number for the current map will be added to all effect IDs (e.g. m13_02 -> adds 132).

halfCamouflage:1.tooltip: If enabled, effects are made semi-transparent rather than fully hidden.

isFullBodyTransformProtectorId:1.tooltip: Indicates whether the armor transformation should be applied to the whole body.

isSilence:1.tooltip: Movement noises are silenced if enabled.

motionId.tooltip: Animation used for talking (-1 for default, or no animation). Usually 7000 (e.g. Fair Lady) or 7001 (e.g. Andre) when used.

returnPos.tooltip: Conversation ID to use instead if the player has 'returned' to this conversation. Used exactly once for one line by the Crestfallen Warrior, so presumably works, but probably not useful.

reactionId.tooltip: Conversation ID to use as 'reaction'. Always -1.

eventId.tooltip: Flag that is enabled when conversation plays (I assume). Used exactly once, for the same Crestfallen Warrior line that uses the ReturnConversation field.

isMotionLoop.tooltip: If True, specified TalkingAnimation will loop while dialogue is being spoken. Always True for any entry that has a non-default TalkingAnimation (e.g. Andre).

Dist.tooltip: Maximum distance at which throw can be triggered.

DiffAngMin.tooltip: Minimum angular difference between attacker's facing direction and defender's facing direction.

DiffAngMax.tooltip: Maximum angular difference between attacker's facing direction and defender's facing direction.

upperYRange.tooltip: Maximum distance that defender can be above attacker.

lowerYRange.tooltip: Maximum distance that defender can be below attacker.

diffAngMyToDef.tooltip: Maximum angular difference between attacker's direction and the direction of the defender.

throwTypeId.tooltip: Throw ID that should be specified in Attacks to use this throw.

atkAnimId.tooltip: Animation played by attacker during throw.

defAnimId.tooltip: Animation played by defender during throw.

escHp.tooltip: Minimum HP percentage required to escape the throw early by mashing buttons. (Not sure if 0 prevents any escape, or if escapes are disabled by another parameter like

selfEscCycleTime.tooltip: Time of escape cycle, in milliseconds. Not sure exactly what it does. Set to 100 milliseconds for throws that can be escaped, and zero otherwise.

sphereCastRadiusRateTop.tooltip: Determines size of upper hemisphere of spherecast. I believe this is a percentage relative to the model size, so a value of 80 will send out a sphere with a radius that is 0.8 times the attacker's model size.

sphereCastRadiusRateLow.tooltip: Determines size of lower hemisphere of spherecast. I believe this is a percentage relative to the model size, so a value of 80 will send out a sphere with a radius that is 0.8 times the attacker's model size.

PadType.tooltip: Determines buttons that can be mashed to escape. Enumeration is unknown, but it is set to 3 for the Centipede Demon grab, Male Ghost grab, and Dark Hand grab, and 1 for every other throw.

AtkEnableState.tooltip: Internal description says 'Set the throwable throwable state type' (?). Set to 1 for all player backstabs and ripostes, and 0 otherwise (including player plunging attacks and all enemy throws).

atkSorbDmyId.tooltip: Model point ID on attacker that defender will be snapped to. If this is zero, 'Snap To Defender Model Point' should be non-zero, and vice versa.

defSorbDmyId.tooltip: Model point ID on defender that attacker will be snapped to. If this is zero, 'Snap To Attacker Model Point' should be non-zero, and vice versa.

throwType.tooltip: Type of throw. Not sure what uses this, but it could affect various things.

selfEscCycleCnt.tooltip: Internal description says 'number of self-throwing cycles'. Always set to 1 when EscapeCycleTime is set to 100 (and MinHPPercentageForEscape is almost always 25). Not sure how it determines *when* you can escape the throw.

dmyHasChrDirType.tooltip: 'Direction of model point possessed character when thrown'. Set to 1 for the Armored Tusk backstab, 255 for the Iron Golem and Gaping Dragon grabs, and 0 otherwise.

isTurnAtker:1.tooltip: Attacker will turn when throw begins (presumably before model point snapping occurs).

isSkipWepCate:1.tooltip: If True, the weapon category check for the attacker will be skipped. Enabled only for Dark Hand drain.

isSkipSphereCast:1.tooltip: If True, the sphere cast check will be skipped. Usually False, but True for the coffin stab, Armored Tusk backstab, and a few large enemy grabs. (Presumably, if False, the throw trigger relies on distance and character angles only and is generally easier to trigger.)

brightnessR.tooltip: Red channel (relative to 1) of tone correct brightness.

brightnessG.tooltip: Green channel (relative to 1) of tone correct brightness.

brightnessB.tooltip: Blue channel (relative to 1) of tone correct brightness.

contrastR.tooltip: Red channel (relative to 1) of tone correct contrast.

contrastG.tooltip: Green channel (relative to 1) of tone correct contrast.

contrastB.tooltip: Blue channel (relative to 1) of tone correct contrast.

bloomBegin.tooltip: Near light blooming begins when brightness exceeds this threshold.

bloomBeginFar.tooltip: Far light blooming begins when brightness exceeds this threshold.

bloomNearDist.tooltip: Near bloom parameters apply up to this maximum distance.

bloomFarDist.tooltip: Far bloom parameters apply beyond this minimum distance.

grayKeyValue.tooltip: Larger values make the screen brighter overall.

minAdaptedLum.tooltip: Minimum brightness for tone adaptation. Smaller values mean that darker places will be adapted.

maxAdapredLum.tooltip: Maximum brightness for tone adaptation. Larger values mean that brighter places will be adapted.

lightShaftBegin.tooltip: Light shafts will appear when brightness exceeds this threshold.

lightShaftPower.tooltip: Light shaft magnitude (0 means no light shafts).

lightShaftAttenRate.tooltip: Smaller values will shorten the light shafts more.

inverseToneMapMul.tooltip: New tone mapping field. (Added in DSR)
